channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Major League Soccer has a new schedule to align with international leagues
item.description: MLS is switching from a spring-to-fall calendar to a summer-to-spring calendar. The move aligns with the rest of international soccer but could pose a challenge for teams in wintry locations.
item.content:encoded: MLS is switching from a spring-to-fall calendar to a summer-to-spring calendar. The move aligns with the rest of international soccer but could pose a challenge for teams in wintry locations.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Do foreign gifts to Trump that align with policy changes raise ethical concerns?
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with former White House ethics lawyer Richard Painter about gifts from foreign governments or corporations that President Trump has accepted.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with former White House ethics lawyer Richard Painter about gifts from foreign governments or corporations that President Trump has accepted.
item.dc:creator: Brianna Scott

item.title: The U.S. didn't send delegates to COP30, but California is filling the void
item.description: The U.S. didn't send high-level delegates to COP30, but states like California are sending representatives and having an impact on the world climate stage.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. didn't send high-level delegates to COP30, but states like California are sending representatives and having an impact on the world climate stage.
item.dc:creator: Laura Klivans

item.title: How NPR edits remarks by the president
item.description: The BBC recently apologized for a documentary it aired in 2024 featuring remarks by President Trump. In light of this news, we wanted to share how NPR handles editing remarks by the president.
item.content:encoded: The BBC recently apologized for a documentary it aired in 2024 featuring remarks by President Trump. In light of this news, we wanted to share how NPR handles editing remarks by the president.
item.dc:creator: Tony Cavin

item.title: Questions remain as Australia moves to ban social media for kids under 16
item.description: In a few weeks, Australia will become the first country to ban children below the age of 16 from having social media accounts.
item.content:encoded: In a few weeks, Australia will become the first country to ban children below the age of 16 from having social media accounts.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: How to scare off hungry gulls
item.description: Neeltje Boogert, an associate professor at the University of Exeter in the U.K., is the senior author of a new scientific study about how to best scare away gulls, out now from the Royal Society.
item.content:encoded: Neeltje Boogert, an associate professor at the University of Exeter in the U.K., is the senior author of a new scientific study about how to best scare away gulls, out now from the Royal Society.
item.dc:creator: Brianna Scott

item.title: Relatives of late artist Norman Rockwell push back on DHS use of paintings
item.description: Norman Rockwell's granddaughter Daisy has condemned the Department of Homeland Security's use of his paintings, saying DHS is misappropriating his art to support policies he would not have endorsed.
item.content:encoded: Norman Rockwell's granddaughter Daisy has condemned the Department of Homeland Security's use of his paintings, saying DHS is misappropriating his art to support policies he would not have endorsed.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: This week in Washington: End of shutdown, Epstein emails and affordability crisis
item.description: The government reopened, more files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein were released, and the White House is shifting some attention to affordability.
item.content:encoded: The government reopened, more files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein were released, and the White House is shifting some attention to affordability.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Chile's election sets up a stark leftâ€“right showdown
item.description: Chile heads to the polls on Sunday, in a fiercely polarized election that mirrors the region's struggles with crime, inflation, and economic stagnation.
item.content:encoded: Chile heads to the polls on Sunday, in a fiercely polarized election that mirrors the region's struggles with crime, inflation, and economic stagnation.
item.dc:creator: John Bartlett

item.title: Amid ICE crackdowns, migrants are sending more money to some Central American countries
item.description: Planet Money talks to immigrants in the U.S. and people in Honduras to try to figure out why remittances are surging to some countries right as it is harder for immigrants here to find work.
item.content:encoded: Planet Money talks to immigrants in the U.S. and people in Honduras to try to figure out why remittances are surging to some countries right as it is harder for immigrants here to find work.
item.dc:creator: Erika Beras
